2.8.1 Afﬁne Subspaces
Deﬁnition 2.25 (Afﬁne Subspace). Let V be a vector space, x0 ∈V and
U ⊆V a subspace. Then the subset
L= x0 + U := {x0 + u: u∈U} (2.130a)
= {v∈V|∃u∈U : v= x0 + u}⊆ V (2.130b)
is called afﬁne subspace or linear manifold of V. U is called direction or afﬁne subspace
